agus.gunit

Class ORBIT

  • java.lang.Object
    • agus.gunit.ORBIT

  • public class ORBIT
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents an Orbit.

    The orbit represented does not have to be the orbit of an spacecraft, but can also be the orbit of a planet.

    If information/parameters are set that will never make an valid orbit this class will not do anything to prevent that on its own.

    If you need to check the orbit for validity use the checkForErrors() class

    Author:
    Niklas Heidenreich

        public ORBIT(krpc.client.services.SpaceCenter.Orbit Orbit,
             BODY Body,
             double UTatStart)
      throws AGuSDataException
        Creates a new orbit object

        Calls every set method of this class and sets it to the calculates of the given orbit

        Parameters:
        Orbit - the orbit
        Body - the body this orbit is around
        UTatStart - the met when the vessel enters the orbit the first time
        Throws:
        AGuSDataException

    • Method Detail

      • getApoapsis

        public double getApoapsis()
        The apoapsis is the highest point of the orbit
        Returns:
        The apoapsis of the orbit in meters measured from the gravitational center

      • setApoapsis

        public void setApoapsis(double newApoapsis)
        Sets the apoapsis to the new value.

        Note: The apoapsis is the highest point of the orbit and can never be less than the periapsis

        Errorchecks: will result in log

        -newApoapsis lower than periapsis

        -newApoapsis is negative

        Parameters:
        newApoapsis - in meters measured from the gravitational center

      • getPeriapsis

        public double getPeriapsis()

        Returns:
        The periapsis of the orbit in meters measured from the gravitational center

      • setPeriapsis

        public void setPeriapsis(double newPeriapsis)
        Sets the periapsis to the new value.

        Note: The periapsis is the lowest point of the orbit and can never be less than the apoapsis

        Errorchecks: will result in log

        -newPeriapsis is higher than apoapsis

        -newPeriapsis is negative

        Parameters:
        newPeriapsis - in meters measured from the gravitational center

      • getUTatNextPeriapsis

        public double getUTatNextPeriapsis(double UT)
        The UT when the vessel will reach the periapsis the next time after the current UT

        Note: If the UT given is at the periapsis the next periapsis met will be returned

        Parameters:
        UT - the met from where to start
        Returns:
        the UT of the next periapsis

      • checkForErrors

        public boolean checkForErrors(boolean fix)
        Checks the Object if the current Orbit is even possible and prints inconsistencis to the log

        Checks following cases in given order:

        -Apoapsis or periapsis negative: makes them positive

        -Apoapsis lower than periapsis: exchange the values

        Parameters:
        fix - if true will try to fix the problems
        Returns:
        true if there where problems
